intro: Villebrunea fruticosa, commonly known as the Madagascar thornapple, is a shrub native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its spiny stems and showy, bell-shaped flowers. The plant produces small, orange fruits that contain seeds surrounded by a fleshy, sticky coating. It thrives in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to the arid conditions of its native environment. Due to its unique appearance and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
